intro: Cyperus laetus subsp. eu-laetus, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a member of the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems that often grow in wet or marshy environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Cyperaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a smooth texture and a tendency to form dense mats. This subspecies is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline or brackish conditions.
